snippet.title: Bumbag of drugs dumped under car
snippet.content:
Police are on the hunt for a man after a bumbag full of drugs was ditched under a car in Beresfield on Wednesday morning. The bumbag contained what police believed was methamphetamine, five ecstacy tablets and a set of electronic scales.
The methamphetamine was stored inside three resealable bags which had a combined weight of 31 grams.
The bumbag discovery came after police spotted a white Hyundai Excel in Yarrum Avenue about 1am.
Police pulled up behind the vehicle after it stopped in front of a house. Two men got out of the car before the male passenger fell to the ground. Unknown to police at the time, the 34-year-old man allegedly placed the bumbag under the vehicle before he got up and walked into a house. Police found the bumbag after the man left the scene.
Officers went to the home to try and arrest the man, but he was not there. The 32-year-old driver of the vehicle was released without penalty. Police inquiries continue into the matter.
